Madison County Parents/Guardians of students with IEPs,

In your report card packet, please look for a letter from your ESE teacher and/or therapist explaining how services will be delivered due to the governor’s mandate of school closures. For Parents of Madison County Students with IEPs or 504 Plans:

As a district, we are working very hard to be sure that ALL students are provided the opportunity to continue learning without too much interruption in this very confusing time. Many of you have IEP or 504 meetings already scheduled or will be scheduled in the near future. We will continue to have these meetings via phone conference to be sure that your child's services and plan stay up-to-date and active. We plan to be very creative in providing these services if we are not able to return to school as planned. State Board of Education Appoints Richard Corcoran to Serve as Florida’s Commissioner of Education.

TALLAHASSEE, Fla., December 17, 2018 – Today, during the State Board of Education meeting, the State Board of Education unanimously voted to appoint Richard Corcoran to serve as Florida’s Commissioner of Education.

Richard Corcoran said, “I look forward to working with the Board to ensure students and their families are empowered to take control of their education options, more resources are directed to Florida’s classrooms and all students have high-performing educators. Governor-elect Ron DeSantis set strong expectations for education in Florida, and I look forward to working with our state’s education stakeholders and the Florida Legislature to ensure Florida’s students have the greatest chance at lifelong success.”
